content.p: Consider the circle centered at the point {{center}} whose circumference is {{circumference}}. Let h = f(d) be the circular function that tracks the height, h, of a point traversing the circle {{direction}} by starting at the point P_0, where d is the distance the point is along the circle from P_0. Find the exact coordinates of 4 points on the circle, and give your best guess for two more. Then, sketch an accurate graph of h = f(d), clearly labeling at least 6 different points on the function, and state the midline, amplitude, and period of the function. Provide a written summary of your computations and thinking.

outtro.p: Here are some important things that will help us figure out points on this circle:

item.p: Since the circumference is {{circumference}}, the period of f(d) is {{circumference}}.
The distance between each point marked on the circle is \frac{ {{circumference}} }{8} = {{deltad}}.
Since the circle is centered at {{center}}, the midline of f(d) is y = {{yc}}.
Since the circumference is {{circumference}}, the radius is \frac{ {{circumference}} }{2\pi} \approx {{radius}}. This will be the amplitude of f(d).
